clinical_study.brief_title: Rectal Water-contrast Transvaginal Ultrasonography Versus Sonovaginography for the Diagnosis of Posterior Deep Pelvic Endometriosis
clinical_study.official_title: Rectal Water-contrast Transvaginal Ultrasonography Versus Sonovaginography for the Diagnosis of Posterior Deep Pelvic Endometriosis

brief_summary.textblock: As the surgical treatment of posterior deep endometriosis may be challenging for surgeons and carry significant risks for patients, preoperative assessment of the location, characteristics and presence of nodules of posterior deep endometriosis is important in order to inform the patient about the various treatment possibilities and to allow adequate counseling regarding treatment strategy. The aim of this study is to investigate the accuracy of rectal water-contrast transvaginal ultrasonography (RWC-TVS), and sonovaginography (SVG) in patients with clinical suspicion of posterior deep endometriosis (DIE).

primary_outcome.measure: Accuracy in diagnosing the presence of the following sites of posterior deep endometriosis: rectovaginal septum, rectosigmoid, uterosacral ligaments, and vagina
primary_outcome.time_frame: At maximum 6 months before undergoing laparoscopic surgical approach

secondary_outcome.measure: Accuracy in estimating the deep of infiltration in the intestinal muscolari propria of nodules of rectosigmoid endometriosis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At maximum 6 months before undergoing laparoscopic surgical approach

secondary_outcome.measure: Accuracy in estimating the distance between rectosigmoid endometriosis nodules and the anal verge
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At maximum 6 months before undergoing laparoscopic surgical approach

secondary_outcome.measure: Accuracy in diagnosing the presence of multifocal rectosigmoid endometriosis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At maximum 6 months before undergoing laparoscopic surgical approach

secondary_outcome.measure: Accuracy in estimating the largest diameter of endometriosis nodules in the following sites of posterior deep endometriosis: rectovaginal septum, rectosigmoid, uterosacral ligaments, and vagina
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At maximum 6 months before undergoing laparoscopic surgical approach

study_pop.textblock: Patients with suspicion of posterior deep infiltrating endometriosis, referring to our academic department for diagnostic purposes

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- clinical presentation suggestive of the presence of posterior deep infiltrating endometriosis
Exclusion Criteria:
- previous diagnosis of posterior deep infiltrating endometriosis by radiologic imaging (i.e. magnetic resonance, computed tomography)
- previous surgical diagnosis of posterior deep infiltrating endometriosis
